citation.article-title: Desulfonatronum lacustre gen. nov., sp. nov.: a new alkaliphilic sulfate-reducing bacterium utilizing ethanol.

p.s: Desulfonatronum (de, negation prefix, sulfo, sulfate, natron, soda, um, ending. Bacterium capable of depleting sulfate in soda lakes, a sulfate reducer inhabiting
Cells are motile, asporogenous, and gram-negative vibrios with a polar flagellum.
Lithoheterotrophic, utilizing hydrogen or organic compounds for the reduction of sulfate.
Obligately dependent on sodium and carbonate ions.
Acetate is necessary for growth on H2 + CO2 as an additional carbon source.
The type species is Desulfonatronum laeustre.
